content.description:
The most direct line to the top- cover easy terrain on questionable rock to the first perma, gather your whits and spot the horizontal crack on the right (east) side of the arete. Pull on, clip your second perma and head straight up with massive deadpoint after massive deadpoint after massive deadpoint (3, at most), passing 2 bolts along the way. Mostly a redpoint crux. 

Options left (face) or right (side pulls around the arete) after the last bolt, choose your own adventure! Rapping advised for your rope.

Straight up the line between the first and second perma, connecting the dots with the 2 bolts above. 
2 permas, 2 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with quick links.

Stick clip the first bolt, the rock is deadly below. 

Goes up the face with one sharp, crumbly hold on the arete. May go up farther than my topo (sector page), but I couldn't see anything and was not going to wage a big run out. Bolts are new, perhaps the line isn't quite finished. 

Just right (east), around the corner from the roof with the perma's. 
2 bolts, 2 bolt anchor (no quick links)

Perhaps the coolest roof climb in the park, featuring both 5.12 cruxes of the slightly longer traverse, with a bonus boulder to turn the lip. 

As with its neighbors, start up easy terrain on poor rock to the first perma-draw. Chalk up, clip your second "free" perma, and then it's all business. Crux one, perma 2-4, skip clipping the 3rd perma. Crux two, perma 4-5. Head up after the 5th perma- before you pull onto the wall take note of the giant hueco below, this is a good landmark to know when to deviate from the traversing line and head up. 

Now that you're good and flamed, head straight up on an easy, but blind V3 boulder. Yup, V3, did I mention you can hear your blood pressure at the start of this boulder? 

Probably best for your rope to rap off. 

Aim for the middle anchors, up from the giant hueco below the perma-draw line. 
permas, 1 bolt/1 hook anchor

Traverses under the lip from the right to the farthest left anchors.

Climb easy terrain up questionable quality rock. Clip the lone perma draw below the roof, perform your ceremonial chalk up and pull on, clipping your second perma from an undercling or a positive right hand hold. Power up, now the climb starts- gun for the obvious slot impossibly far to your left.

After settling your hands and feet, skip the 3rd perma and directly clip the 4th (or clip them in the same motion). Gather yourself, and power up for another big move to an impossibly farther hold to your left. Settle down, clip the 5th perma, and go fishing for holds. One last big move guards features that you can rest on and get something back, before clipping the last perma and lone bolt, moving up the arete to the anchors. 

Aim for the left-most (west) anchors, connect the dotted line of perma's.
6 permas, 1 bolt, 2 bolt anchor with biners.

This sector is effectively a giant overhanging boulder, featuring a row of perma-draws across the bottom with 3 exit options. All 3 of these lines are stellar and are Cedar Park must do's!

All day sun, but, most of the holds just under the lip of the overhang never see sun.

*Developed by Todd Guy & Mike Doyle in 1995
